title: LaTeX Basics
text:
Welcome to the basics of LaTeX. In this tutorial, we cover: - How to write simple documents. - Basic text formatting. - Inserting equations.


Below is a simple equation written in LaTeX:
\[
E = mc^2
\]
Experiment with different LaTeX commands to get familiar with document formatting.

title: About
text:
Markdown
Markdown is an easy to read and write text format:

It’s plain text so works well with version control
It can be rendered into HTML, PDF, and more
Learn more at: https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/

title: About
text:
Code Cell
Here is a Python code cell:

import time 
import random

print(time.time())
print(random.randint(1,100))

1740251008.0527472

title: About
text:
Equation
Use LaTeX to write equations:
\[
\chi' = \sum_{i=2}^n k_i s_i^2
\]

title: Advanced LaTeX Techniques
text:
This tutorial explores advanced LaTeX features including: - Custom commands and environments. - Package management. - Creating custom templates.


You can define a new command in LaTeX as follows:
\newcommand{\R}{\mathbb{R}}
Now, you can use \(\R\) to denote the set of real numbers.
Try incorporating more advanced packages and settings to enhance your document’s design.
